i18n.oblique.http.error.status.502: In order to process your request, the server acted as a gateway or proxy and did not receive a valid response itself.
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.503.title: Service unavailable
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.503: We are sorry, the server is not responding at the moment. Please try again later.
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.504.title: Gateway timeout
i18n.oblique.http.error.status.504: In order to process your request, the server acted as a gateway or proxy and did not receive a timely response itself.
i18n.oblique.http.error.timeout: The server is taking too long to respond. Please try again later or contact the support.

i18n.oblique.accessibility-statement.inf: Information and services that are available digitally make it easier for people with disabilities to communicate with public sector bodies. This enables social involvement and political participation for all.
i18n.oblique.accessibility-statement.the: The Federal Administration strives to make web content and mobile applications accessible. The eCH-0059 Accessibility Standard Version 3 requires compliance with the criteria of WCAG 2.1 at conformance level AA.
i18n.oblique.accessibility-statement.pro: Accessibility provisions are set out in the following ordinances:

• Article 9 of the UN Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (UN CRPD) explains the guarantee of equal access to information and services for the public.
  • Article 8 paragraph 2 of the Federal Constitution states that no person may be discriminated against because of a physical, mental or psychological disability.
  • The Disability Discrimination Act (DDA) requires measures to be taken to prevent, reduce or eliminate discrimination.
  • The Ordinance on the Elimination of Discrimination against People with Disabilities (EPDO) contains provisions on the requirements to accommodate people with disabilities when designing federal services.
  • Article 3 Principles Federal Act on the Use of Electronic Means for the Fulfillment of Official Tasks (EMBAG). Paragraph 4 They shall ensure that their services are accessible to the entire population.
i18n.oblique.accessibility-statement.exc: The content listed below is not accessible for the following reasons:
i18n.oblique.accessibility-statement.dat: The accessibility statement was created on {{createdOn}}.
The accessibility statement was last reviewed on {{reviewedOn}}.
i18n.oblique.accessibility-statement.fee: If you have encountered a problem regarding accessibility, you can contact us.
i18n.oblique.accessibility-statement.gen: Federal Bureau for the Equality of People with Disabilities FBED
E-Accessibility Office (in German, French and Italian)
Guidance and fact sheets for accessible digital communication (in German, French and Italian)
i18n.oblique.accessibility-statement.acc: eCH-0059 Accessibility Standard Version 3 (in German and French)
Ordinance on the Elimination of Discrimination against People with Disabilities (EPDO) (in German, French and Italian)
Article 8 of the Federal Constitution, Equality before the law
Rights for people with disabilities in accessible formats (in German, French and Italian)
Art. 3 Principles Federal Act on the Use of Electronic Means for the Fulfillment of Official Tasks (EMBAG) (in German, French and Italian)
